entry.title: Pathologically Eclectic Rubbish Lister
entry.summary: For many years I wrote most of my code in the Perl programming language. Now I've been a exclusively java programmers for five years

div.p: The Perl programming language was created by Larry Wall, who declared that the name was an abbreviation of Pathologically Eclectic Rubbish Lister, or possibly Practical Extraction and Report Language. I've used it a lot and I'm not ashamed of it. And I still use it. In spite of the fact that some people say it's dying. However, now when I'm more or less completetly converted to JAVA, we are actually discussing to switch part of our development to Ruby on Rails.
